Structs/SocketPacket/PacketType.html#/s:.name: isBinary
Structs/SocketPacket/PacketType.html#/s:.abstract: Whether or not this type is binary

Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: id
Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: If > 0 then this packet is using acking.

Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: binary
Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: An array of binary data for this packet.

Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: args
Structs/SocketPacket.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Returns the payload for this packet, minus the event name if this is an event or binaryEvent type packet.

Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.name: count
Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.abstract: The number of elements stored in this collection.

Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.name: init(arrayLiteral:)
Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.abstract: Creates a new SocketIOClientConfiguration from an array literal.

Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.name: insert(_:replacing:)
Structs/SocketIOClientConfiguration.html.abstract: Special method that inserts element into the collection, replacing any other instances of element.

Structs/SocketPacket.html.name: SocketPacket
Structs/SocketPacket.html.abstract: A struct that represents a socket.io packet.

Protocols/SocketData.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: socketRepresentation()
Protocols/SocketData.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: A representation of self that can sent over socket.io.

Protocols/SocketDataBufferable.html#/s:8.name: waitingPackets
Protocols/SocketDataBufferable.html#/s:8.abstract: A list of packets that are waiting for binary data.

Protocols/SocketParsable.html#/s:8Socket.name: parseBinaryData(_:)
Protocols/SocketParsable.html#/s:8Socket.abstract: Called when the engine has received some binary data that should be attached to a packet.

Protocols/SocketParsable.html#/s:8Socket.name: parseSocketMessage(_:)
Protocols/SocketParsable.html#/s:8Socket.abstract: Called when the engine has received a string that should be parsed into a socket.io packet.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: defaultSocket
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Returns the socket associated with the default namespace (“/”).

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: engine
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The engine for this manager.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: forceNew
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: If true then every time connect is called, a new engine will be created.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: handleQueue
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The queue that all interaction with the client should occur on. This is the queue that event handlers are

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: nsps
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The sockets in this manager indexed by namespace.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: reconnects
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: If true, this manager will try and reconnect on any disconnects.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: reconnectWait
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The minimum number of seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: reconnectWaitMax
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The maximum number of seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: randomizationFactor
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The randomization factor for calculating reconnect jitter.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: socketURL
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The URL of the socket.io server.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: status
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The status of this manager.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: version
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: The version of socket.io in use.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: connect()
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Connects the underlying transport.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: connectSocket(_:withPayload:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Connects a socket through this manager’s engine.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: didDisconnect(reason:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Called when the manager has disconnected from socket.io.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: disconnect()
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Disconnects the manager and all associated sockets.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: disconnectSocket(_:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Disconnects the given socket.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: disconnectSocket(forNamespace:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Disconnects the socket associated with forNamespace.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: emitAll(_:_:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Sends an event to the server on all namespaces in this manager.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: reconnect()
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Tries to reconnect to the server.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: removeSocket(_:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Removes the socket from the manager’s control.

Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.name: socket(forNamespace:)
Protocols/SocketManagerSpec.html#/s:8Soc.abstract: Returns a SocketIOClient for the given namespace. This socket shares a transport with the manager.

Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html#/s:.name: wsConnected
Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html#/s:.abstract: Whether or not the ws is connected

Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html#/s:.name: sendWebSocketMessage(_:withType:withData:completion:)
Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html#/s:.abstract: Sends an engine.io message through the WebSocket transport.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: client
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The client for this engine.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: closed
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: true if this engine is closed.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: compress
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If true the engine will attempt to use WebSocket compression.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: connected
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: true if this engine is connected. Connected means that the initial poll connect has succeeded.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: connectParams
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The connect parameters sent during a connect.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: cookies
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: An array of HTTPCookies that are sent during the connection.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: engineQueue
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The queue that all engine actions take place on.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: extraHeaders
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: A dictionary of extra http headers that will be set during connection.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: fastUpgrade
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: When true, the engine is in the process of switching to WebSockets.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: forcePolling
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: When true, the engine will only use HTTP long-polling as a transport.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: forceWebsockets
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: When true, the engine will only use WebSockets as a transport.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: polling
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If true, the engine is currently in HTTP long-polling mode.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: probing
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If true, the engine is currently seeing whether it can upgrade to WebSockets.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: sid
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The session id for this engine.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: socketPath
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The path to engine.io.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: urlPolling
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The url for polling.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: urlWebSocket
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The url for WebSockets.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: version
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The version of engine.io being used. Default is three.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: websocket
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If true, then the engine is currently in WebSockets mode.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: ws
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The WebSocket for this engine.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: init(client:url:options:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Creates a new engine.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: connect()
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Starts the connection to the server.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: didError(reason:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Called when an error happens during execution. Causes a disconnection.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: disconnect(reason:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Disconnects from the server.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: doFastUpgrade()
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Called to switch from HTTP long-polling to WebSockets. After calling this method the engine will be in

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: flushWaitingForPostToWebSocket()
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Causes any packets that were waiting for POSTing to be sent through the WebSocket. This happens because when

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: parseEngineData(_:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Parses raw binary received from engine.io.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: parseEngineMessage(_:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Parses a raw engine.io packet.

Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.name: write(_:withType:withData:completion:)
Protocols/SocketEngineSpec.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Writes a message to engine.io, independent of transport.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: invalidated
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: true If engine’s session has been invalidated.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: postWait
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: A queue of engine.io messages waiting for POSTing

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: session
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: The URLSession that will be used for polling.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: waitingForPoll
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: true if there is an outstanding poll. Trying to poll before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: waitingForPost
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: true if there is an outstanding post. Trying to post before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: sendPollMessage(_:withType:withData:completion:)
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: Sends an engine.io message through the polling transport.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.name: stopPolling()
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html#/s:8.abstract: Call to stop polling and invalidate the URLSession.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: engineDidReceivePing()
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine receives a ping message. Only called in socket.io >3.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: engineDidReceivePong()
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine receives a pong message. Only called in socket.io 2.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: engineDidSendPing()
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine sends a ping to the server. Only called in socket.io 2.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: engineDidSendPong()
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine sends a pong to the server. Only called in socket.io >3.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: parseEngineMessage(_:)
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine has a message that must be parsed.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: parseEngineBinaryData(_:)
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when the engine receives binary data.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.name: engineDidWebsocketUpgrade(headers:)
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Called when when upgrading the http connection to a websocket connection.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: anyHandler
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: A handler that will be called on any event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: handlers
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: The array of handlers for this socket.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: manager
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: The manager for this socket.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: nsp
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: The namespace that this socket is currently connected to.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: rawEmitView
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: A view into this socket where emits do not check for binary data.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: sid
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: The id of this socket.io connect. This is different from the sid of the engine.io connection.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: status
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: The status of this client.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: connect(withPayload:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Connect to the server. The same as calling connect(timeoutAfter:withHandler:) with a timeout of 0.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: connect(withPayload:timeoutAfter:withHandler:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Connect to the server. If we aren’t connected after timeoutAfter seconds, then withHandler is called.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: didConnect(toNamespace:payload:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called when the client connects to a namespace. If the client was created with a namespace upfront,

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: didDisconnect(reason:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called when the client has disconnected from socket.io.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: didError(reason:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called when the client encounters an error.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: disconnect()
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Disconnects the socket.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: emit(_:_:completion:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Send an event to the server, with optional data items and optional write completion handler.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: emitAck(_:with:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Call when you wish to tell the server that you’ve received the event for ack.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: emitWithAck(_:_:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Sends a message to the server, requesting an ack.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: handleAck(_:data:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called when socket.io has acked one of our emits. Causes the corresponding ack callback to be called.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: handleClientEvent(_:data:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called on socket.io specific events.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: handleEvent(_:data:isInternalMessage:withAck:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Called when we get an event from socket.io.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: handlePacket(_:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Causes a client to handle a socket.io packet. The namespace for the packet must match the namespace of the

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: leaveNamespace()
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Call when you wish to leave a namespace and disconnect this socket.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: joinNamespace(withPayload:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Joins nsp. You shouldn’t need to call this directly, instead call connect.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: off(clientEvent:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Removes handler(s) for a client event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: off(_:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Removes handler(s) based on an event name.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: off(id:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Removes a handler with the specified UUID gotten from an on or once

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: on(_:callback:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Adds a handler for an event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: on(clientEvent:callback:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Adds a handler for a client event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: once(clientEvent:callback:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Adds a single-use handler for a client event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: once(_:callback:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Adds a single-use handler for an event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: onAny(_:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Adds a handler that will be called on every event.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: removeAllHandlers()
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Removes all handlers.

Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.name: setReconnecting(reason:)
Protocols/SocketIOClientSpec.html#/s:8So.abstract: Puts the socket back into the connecting state.

Protocols/ConfigSettable.html#/s:8Socket.name: setConfigs(_:)
Protocols/ConfigSettable.html#/s:8Socket.abstract: Called when an ConfigSettable should set/update its configs from a given configuration.

Protocols/ConfigSettable.html.name: ConfigSettable
Protocols/ConfigSettable.html.abstract: Declares that a type can set configs from a SocketIOClientConfiguration.

Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html.name: SocketEngineClient
Protocols/SocketEngineClient.html.abstract: Declares that a type will be a delegate to an engine.

Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html.name: SocketEnginePollable
Protocols/SocketEnginePollable.html.abstract: Protocol that is used to implement socket.io polling support

Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html.name: SocketEngineWebsocket
Protocols/SocketEngineWebsocket.html.abstract: Protocol that is used to implement socket.io WebSocket support

Protocols/SocketParsable.html.name: SocketParsable
Protocols/SocketParsable.html.abstract: Defines that a type will be able to parse socket.io-protocol messages.

Protocols/SocketDataBufferable.html.name: SocketDataBufferable
Protocols/SocketDataBufferable.html.abstract: Says that a type will be able to buffer binary data before all data for an event has come in.

Protocols/SocketLogger.html.name: SocketLogger
Protocols/SocketLogger.html.abstract: Represents a class will log client events.

Protocols/SocketData.html.name: SocketData
Protocols/SocketData.html.abstract: A marking protocol that says a type can be represented in a socket.io packet.

Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.name: invalidDataArray
Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.abstract: Thrown when a packet received has an invalid data array, or is missing the data array.

Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.name: invalidPacket
Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.abstract: Thrown when an malformed packet is received.

Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.name: invalidPacketType
Enums/SocketParsableError.html#/s:8Socke.abstract: Thrown when the parser receives an unknown packet type.

Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.name: notConnected
Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.abstract: The client/manager has never been connected. Or the client has been reset.

Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.name: disconnected
Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.abstract: The client/manager was once connected, but not anymore.

Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.name: connecting
Enums/SocketIOStatus.html#/c:@M@SocketIO.abstract: The client/manager is in the process of connecting.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: connect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted when the client connects. This is also called on a successful reconnection. A connect event gets one

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: disconnect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted when the socket has disconnected and will not attempt to try to reconnect.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: ping
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted whenever the engine sends a ping.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: pong
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted whenever the engine gets a pong.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: reconnect
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted when the client begins the reconnection process.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: reconnectAttempt
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted each time the client tries to reconnect to the server.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: statusChange
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted every time there is a change in the client’s status.

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.name: websocketUpgrade
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html#/s:8SocketI.abstract: Emitted when when upgrading the http connection to a websocket connection.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: compress
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If given, the WebSocket transport will attempt to use compression.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: connectParams(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: A dictionary of GET parameters that will be included in the connect url.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: cookies(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: An array of cookies that will be sent during the initial connection.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: extraHeaders(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Any extra HTTP headers that should be sent during the initial connection.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: forceNew(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed true, will cause the client to always create a new engine. Useful for debugging,

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: forcePolling(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed true, the only transport that will be used will be HTTP long-polling.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: forceWebsockets(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed true, the only transport that will be used will be WebSockets.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: enableSOCKSProxy(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed true, the WebSocket stream will be configured with the enableSOCKSProxy true.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: handleQueue(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The queue that all interaction with the client should occur on. This is the queue that event handlers are

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: log(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed true, the client will log debug information. This should be turned off in production code.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: logger(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Used to pass in a custom logger.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: path(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: A custom path to socket.io. Only use this if the socket.io server is configured to look for this path.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: reconnects(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If passed false, the client will not reconnect when it loses connection. Useful if you want full control

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: reconnectAttempts(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The number of times to try and reconnect before giving up. Pass -1 to never give up.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: reconnectWait(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The minimum number of seconds to wait before reconnect attempts.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: reconnectWaitMax(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The maximum number of seconds to wait before reconnect attempts.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: randomizationFactor(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The randomization factor for calculating reconnect jitter.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: secure(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Set true if your server is using secure transports.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: security(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Allows you to set which certs are valid. Useful for SSL pinning.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: selfSigned(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: If you’re using a self-signed set. Only use for development.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: sessionDelegate(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: Sets an NSURLSessionDelegate for the underlying engine. Useful if you need to handle self-signed certs.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: version(_:)
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The version of socket.io being used. This should match the server version. Default is 3.

Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.name: description
Enums/SocketIOClientOption.html#/s:8Sock.abstract: The description of this option.
Compares whether two options are the same.

Enums/SocketAckStatus.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Tests whether a string is equal to a given SocketAckStatus
Tests whether a string is equal to a given SocketAckStatus

Enums/SocketClientEvent.html.name: SocketClientEvent
Enums/SocketClientEvent.html.abstract: The set of events that are generated by the client.

Enums/SocketIOStatus.html.name: SocketIOStatus
Enums/SocketIOStatus.html.abstract: Represents state of a manager or client.

Enums/SocketEnginePacketType.html.name: SocketEnginePacketType
Enums/SocketEnginePacketType.html.abstract: Represents the type of engine.io packet types.

Enums/SocketParsableError.html.name: SocketParsableError
Enums/SocketParsableError.html.abstract: Errors that can be thrown during parsing.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: defaultSocket
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The socket associated with the default namespace (“/”).

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: socketURL
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The URL of the socket.io server.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: config
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The configuration for this client.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: engine
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The engine for this manager.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: forceNew
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: If true then every time connect is called, a new engine will be created.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: handleQueue
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The queue that all interaction with the client should occur on. This is the queue that event handlers are

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: nsps
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The sockets in this manager indexed by namespace.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: reconnects
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: If true, this client will try and reconnect on any disconnects.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: reconnectWait
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The minimum number of seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: reconnectWaitMax
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The maximum number of seconds to wait before attempting to reconnect.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: randomizationFactor
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The randomization factor for calculating reconnect jitter.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: status
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: The status of this manager.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: waitingPackets
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: A list of packets that are waiting for binary data.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: init(socketURL:config:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Type safe way to create a new SocketIOClient. opts can be omitted.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: init(socketURL:config:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Not so type safe way to create a SocketIOClient, meant for Objective-C compatiblity.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: connect()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Connects the underlying transport and the default namespace socket.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: connectSocket(_:withPayload:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Connects a socket through this manager’s engine.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: didDisconnect(reason:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Called when the manager has disconnected from socket.io.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: disconnect()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Disconnects the manager and all associated sockets.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: disconnectSocket(_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Disconnects the given socket.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: disconnectSocket(forNamespace:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Disconnects the socket associated with forNamespace.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: emitAll(clientEvent:data:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Sends a client event to all sockets in nsps

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: emitAll(_:_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Sends an event to the server on all namespaces in this manager.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: engineDidReceivePing()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the engine receives a ping message.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: engineDidSendPing()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the sends a ping to the server.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: engineDidReceivePong()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the engine receives a pong message.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: engineDidSendPong()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the sends a pong to the server.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: engineDidWebsocketUpgrade(headers:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when when upgrading the http connection to a websocket connection.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: parseEngineMessage(_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the engine has a message that must be parsed.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: parseEngineBinaryData(_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Called when the engine receives binary data.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: reconnect()
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Tries to reconnect to the server.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: removeSocket(_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Removes the socket from the manager’s control. One of the disconnect methods should be called before calling this

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: setConfigs(_:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Sets manager specific configs.

Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: socket(forNamespace:)
Classes/SocketManager.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Returns a SocketIOClient for the given namespace. This socket shares a transport with the manager.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: engineQueue
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The queue that all engine actions take place on.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: connectParams
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The connect parameters sent during a connect.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: extraHeaders
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: A dictionary of extra http headers that will be set during connection.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: postWait
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: A queue of engine.io messages waiting for POSTing

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: waitingForPoll
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: true if there is an outstanding poll. Trying to poll before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: waitingForPost
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: true if there is an outstanding post. Trying to post before the first is done will cause socket.io to

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: closed
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: true if this engine is closed.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: compress
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: If true the engine will attempt to use WebSocket compression.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: connected
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: true if this engine is connected. Connected means that the initial poll connect has succeeded.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: cookies
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: An array of HTTPCookies that are sent during the connection.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: fastUpgrade
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: When true, the engine is in the process of switching to WebSockets.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: forcePolling
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: When true, the engine will only use HTTP long-polling as a transport.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: forceWebsockets
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: When true, the engine will only use WebSockets as a transport.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: invalidated
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: true If engine’s session has been invalidated.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: polling
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: If true, the engine is currently in HTTP long-polling mode.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: probing
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: If true, the engine is currently seeing whether it can upgrade to WebSockets.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: session
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The URLSession that will be used for polling.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: sid
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The session id for this engine.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: socketPath
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The path to engine.io.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: urlPolling
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The url for polling.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: urlWebSocket
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The url for WebSockets.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: version
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The version of engine.io being used. Default is three.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: websocket
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: If true, then the engine is currently in WebSockets mode.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: enableSOCKSProxy
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: When true, the WebSocket stream will be configured with the enableSOCKSProxy true.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: ws
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The WebSocket for this engine.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: wsConnected
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Whether or not the WebSocket is currently connected.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: client
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: The client for this engine.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: init(client:url:config:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Creates a new engine.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: init(client:url:options:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Creates a new engine.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: connect()
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Starts the connection to the server.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: didError(reason:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Called when an error happens during execution. Causes a disconnection.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: disconnect(reason:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Disconnects from the server.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: doFastUpgrade()
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Called to switch from HTTP long-polling to WebSockets. After calling this method the engine will be in

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: flushWaitingForPostToWebSocket()
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Causes any packets that were waiting for POSTing to be sent through the WebSocket. This happens because when

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: parseEngineData(_:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Parses raw binary received from engine.io.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: parseEngineMessage(_:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Parses a raw engine.io packet.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: setConfigs(_:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Called when the engine should set/update its configs from a given configuration.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: write(_:withType:withData:completion:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Writes a message to engine.io, independent of transport.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: URLSession(session:didBecomeInvalidWithError:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Delegate called when the session becomes invalid.

Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.name: didReceive(event:client:)
Classes/SocketEngine.html#/s:8SocketIO0A.abstract: Delegate method for WebSocketDelegate.

Classes/SocketRawView.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: emit(_:_:)
Classes/SocketRawView.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Send an event to the server, with optional data items.

Classes/SocketRawView.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: emit(_:with:)
Classes/SocketRawView.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Same as emit, but meant for Objective-C

Classes/SocketRawView.html#/s:8SocketIO0.name: emitWithAck(_:_:)
Classes/SocketRawView.html#/s:8SocketIO0.abstract: Sends a message to the server, requesting an ack.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: nsp
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: The namespace that this socket is currently connected to.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: anyHandler
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: A handler that will be called on any event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: handlers
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: The array of handlers for this socket.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: manager
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: The manager for this socket.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: rawEmitView
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: A view into this socket where emits do not check for binary data.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: status
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: The status of this client.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: sid
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: The id of this socket.io connect. This is different from the sid of the engine.io connection.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: init(manager:nsp:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Type safe way to create a new SocketIOClient. opts can be omitted.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: connect(withPayload:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Connect to the server. The same as calling connect(timeoutAfter:withHandler:) with a timeout of 0.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: connect(withPayload:timeoutAfter:withHandler:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Connect to the server. If we aren’t connected after timeoutAfter seconds, then withHandler is called.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: didConnect(toNamespace:payload:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Called when the client connects to a namespace. If the client was created with a namespace upfront,

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: didDisconnect(reason:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Called when the client has disconnected from socket.io.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: disconnect()
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Disconnects the socket.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: emit(_:_:completion:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Send an event to the server, with optional data items and optional write completion handler.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: emitWithAck(_:_:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Sends a message to the server, requesting an ack.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: emitAck(_:with:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Call when you wish to tell the server that you’ve received the event for ack.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: handleAck(_:data:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Called when socket.io has acked one of our emits. Causes the corresponding ack callback to be called.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: handleClientEvent(_:data:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Called on socket.io specific events.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: handleEvent(_:data:isInternalMessage:withAck:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Called when we get an event from socket.io.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: handlePacket(_:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Causes a client to handle a socket.io packet. The namespace for the packet must match the namespace of the

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: leaveNamespace()
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Call when you wish to leave a namespace and disconnect this socket.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: joinNamespace(withPayload:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Joins nsp. You shouldn’t need to call this directly, instead call connect.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: off(clientEvent:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Removes handler(s) for a client event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: off(_:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Removes handler(s) based on an event name.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: off(id:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Removes a handler with the specified UUID gotten from an on or once

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: on(_:callback:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Adds a handler for an event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: on(clientEvent:callback:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Adds a handler for a client event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: once(clientEvent:callback:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Adds a single-use handler for a client event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: once(_:callback:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Adds a single-use handler for an event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: onAny(_:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Adds a handler that will be called on every event.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: removeAllHandlers()
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Removes all handlers.

Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.name: setReconnecting(reason:)
Classes/SocketIOClient.html#/s:8SocketIO.abstract: Puts the socket back into the connecting state.

Classes/OnAckCallback.html#/c:@M@SocketI.name: timingOut(after:callback:)
Classes/OnAckCallback.html#/c:@M@SocketI.abstract: Completes an emitWithAck. If this isn’t called, the emit never happens.

Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html#/c:@M@Sock.name: rawEmitView
Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html#/c:@M@Sock.abstract: A view into this emitter where emits do not check for binary data.

Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html#/s:8Socket.name: expected
Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html#/s:8Socket.abstract: If true, this handler is expecting to be acked. Call with(_: SocketData...) to ack.

Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html.name: SocketAckEmitter
Classes/SocketAckEmitter.html.abstract: A class that represents a waiting ack call.

Classes/OnAckCallback.html.name: OnAckCallback
Classes/OnAckCallback.html.abstract: A class that represents an emit that will request an ack that has not yet been sent.

Classes/SocketRawView.html.name: SocketRawView
Classes/SocketRawView.html.abstract: Class that gives a backwards compatible way to cause an emit not to recursively check for Data objects.

Classes/SocketRawAckView.html.name: SocketRawAckView
Classes/SocketRawAckView.html.abstract: Class that gives a backwards compatible way to cause an emit not to recursively check for Data objects.

Classes/SocketEngine.html.name: SocketEngine
Classes/SocketEngine.html.abstract: The class that handles the engine.io protocol and transports.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
